title: IAF to conduct major exercise in Rajasthan from July 23; NOTAM issued¬†¬†
content: According to sources, the Indian Air Force is set to carry out a major military exercise in Rajasthan, covering areas from Barmer to Jodhpur

content: On July 20, the State government constituted the SIT, headed by IPS officer Pronab Mohanty, Director-General of Police, Internal Security Division

title: VP quits abruptly: Dhankhar caught govt unaware by allowing notice against Varma in RS
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar abruptly resigned, citing health reasons, just before completing two years in office. His resignation, submitted to President Droupadi Murmu, took effect immediately. The move has sparked speculation, especially given his recent cardiac procedure and fainting spell, despite appearing well on Monday. Dhankhar, who assumed office in August 2022, was expected to serve until 2027.

title: Bihar hospital shooting: 2 murder suspects shot in encounter with cops; 7 held so far
content: Two suspects in the daylight murder of gangster Chandan Mishra at a Patna hospital were injured in a police encounter in Arrah. The suspects were part of a group that fatally shot Mishra, who was out on parole for surgery. Following arrests in Kolkata, police traced the gang, leading to the encounter and ongoing interrogations of ten suspects.

title: ‚ÄòSubject to divine intervention‚Äô: VP Dhankhar‚Äôs old video resurfaces; 10 days later he quits
content: Vice-president Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned on Monday evening, citing medical reasons, cutting short his term scheduled to end in August 2027. His resignation, which came on the first day of Parliament's Monsoon session, has sparked political speculation. An old video resurfaced where Dhankhar mentioned his retirement in August 2027, "subject to divine intervention".

title: IND vs ENG: India out to achieve first-ever feat in their history - in numbers
content: India face England in the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford, with Jasprit Bumrah set to play despite workload concerns. Siraj all but confirmed Bumrah's participation in the Test that starts July 23, while India grapples with selection challenges due to injuries to Akash Deep and Nitish Kumar Reddy. India trail the series 1-2 after three Tests.

title: 'Living in denial': Elon Musk admits; says ‚ÄòNow it is game on‚Äô
content: Elon Musk, acknowledging his past resistance to AI, has declared ‚Äúgame on,‚Äù signaling a more aggressive approach to the technology. This shift follows his earlier warnings about AI's potential dangers. Musk's renewed focus is evident through xAI, his startup competing with industry giants.

title: WCL | 'Don't play against us in ICC tournaments, Olympics' - Ex-Pakistan skipper
content: Former Pakistan captain Salman Butt has strongly criticized Yuvraj Singh's India Champions for withdrawing from the World Championship of Legends match against Pakistan. Butt questioned the message sent to cricket fans and challenged India to boycott Pakistan in all tournaments, including the Olympics.

title: IND vs ENG | ‚ÄòDekho, desh ke liye khelta hoon‚Äô - Mohammed Siraj
content: Mohammed Siraj expressed his disappointment over India's Lord's Test defeat, recalling his previous success at the same venue in 2021. He emphasized his commitment to giving his all for the country and his desire to play as many matches as possible. Siraj also credited his fitness to the Almighty, looking forward to the upcoming Test at Old Trafford.

title: H-1B visa data reveals how much Nike pays its Software engineers in the US
content: Nike's H-1B visa data reveals software engineer salaries in the US, ranging from $139,845 to $301,378 based on specialization. The company's investment in tech roles reflects its digital transformation. While Nike sponsors roles in data, product, and design, primarily in Beaverton, Oregon, it's also undergoing restructuring, including tech division job cuts and outsourcing to third-party vendors.

title: 'They hate straight, white CEOs': MAGA host says Leftists behind Coldplay saga
content: Pro-MAGA commentator Jack Posobiec said the backlash against Astronomer's former CEO, Andy Byron, stemmed from Leftists' animosity towards white, straight CEOs. Andy Byron resigned after a video of him with the company's HR chief at a Coldplay concert went viral, sparking outrage. The company is now under new leadership, with Pete DeJoy taking over as CEO.

title: New twist! Pakistan refuse to share points, say 'India backed out'
content: The World Champions of Legends (WCL) announced the cancellation of the highly anticipated India-Pakistan match at Edgbaston, citing their inability to conduct the game. The decision follows the refusal of several Indian players, including Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan, to participate due to heightened geo-political tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Gurgaon teen stabs boy 20 times with scissors
content: In Gurgaon, a 16-year-old boy was apprehended for allegedly murdering his seven-year-old neighbor. The gruesome act involved stabbing the younger boy nearly 20 times with scissors, concealing the body near the KMP Expressway.

title: Gita Gopinath quits IMF, to return to Harvard in August
content: Gita Gopinath, the IMF's First Deputy Managing Director, will depart at the end of August to return to Harvard University. Her exit, surprising to many, opens an opportunity for the U.S. Treasury to propose a successor amidst global trade dynamic shifts. Gopinath, the first female chief economist, joined the IMF in 2019 and was promoted in 2022.

title: 'People were screaming, running': Eyewitnesses recall Bangladesh air crash horror
content: A Bangladesh Air Force fighter jet crashed into the Milestone School and College in Dhaka, resulting in a devastating scene of fire and panic. The accident claimed the lives of at least 25 people, including students and the pilot, and left over 170 injured.

title: As Dhankhar resigns, NDA in huddle over VP post; who‚Äôs in the running?
content: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned on Monday, citing health reasons, creating a vacancy for a new vice-president. His resignation surprised the BJP-led NDA, which will now consider potential candidates. The BJP is expected to select a nominee from a pool of governors, senior leaders, or Union ministers. Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh is among those being considered.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,100; BSE Sensex up over 150 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went above 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 150 points.

title: Trump ‚Äòcaught off guard‚Äô by Israeli strikes on Syria, Gaza: White House
content: US President Donald Trump expressed surprise at Israel's military actions in Syria and Gaza. White House confirmed Trump discussed the matter with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Israel stated the Syria operation aimed to pressure Syrian forces. A US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Syria has commenced. Netanyahu attributed the Gaza church strike to a stray missile.

title: IND vs ENG: 'McCullum‚Äôs ‚Äòtoo nice‚Äô jibe lit fire under England on Day 5' - Brook
content: Harry Brook revealed that Brendon McCullum's comment about England being "too nice" fueled their aggressive approach on Day 5 against India at Lord's. Brook stated that the team decided to shed their friendly image after witnessing Indian players confront their teammates. England aimed to apply pressure without resorting to personal attacks or unsportsmanlike conduct.

title: 'Saiyaara' crosses Rs 100 crore mark; sees minor dip on first Monday
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama, 'Saiyaara,' starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has remarkably grossed over Rs 100 crore in just four days. Defying expectations, the film has become a sleeper hit of 2025, setting a new benchmark for films featuring debutant actors. Its emotional narrative and strong performances have resonated with audiences and industry peers alike.

title: Aadhaar, voter ID & ration cards can‚Äôt be considered for SIR: EC
content: The Election Commission of India disagreed with the Supreme Court's view on using Aadhaar, voter ID, and ration cards for Bihar's electoral roll Special Summary Revision. EC stated these documents are unreliable. Aadhaar is just an identity proof. Many fake ration cards exist. Using current voter cards would defeat the purpose of the special drive.

title: Buried beneath new tiles: Man‚Äôs body found after switched off phone raises alarm
content: In Nalasopara (east), a shocking discovery unfolded as the body of 32-year-old Vijay Chauhan was found buried within his own home, prompting a police investigation. Suspicion arose when Chauhan's brothers noticed newly laid floor tiles and the unexplained absence of his wife, Chaman Devi.

title: Richard Tillman‚Äôs mental health crisis ends in fiery arrest
content: Richard Tillman, brother of the late Pat Tillman, faces arson charges after allegedly setting fire to a San Jose post office. His family reveals a long battle with severe, untreated mental illness, evidenced by erratic online behavior. They claim the mental health system failed to provide adequate support despite visible signs of his deteriorating condition, leading to this crisis.

title: Trump admin releases MLK Jr., Hillary probe files; what do they reveal?
content: The Trump administration has released thousands of documents related to the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. in 1968 and Hillary Clinton's email controversy. The King files detail the investigation into James Earl Ray and international intelligence cooperation. The Clinton documents reveal alleged FBI negligence in investigating her handling of classified information, raising questions about political influence.

title: 'Stabbed 14 times': Jaipur man butchered in public, accused posts 'revenge' boast
content: Jaipur witnessed widespread protests after the brutal murder of Vipin Kumar, allegedly by Mohammad Anas, disrupting traffic on the Jaipur-Agra highway. Accused Anas, a known history-sheeter, was arrested after attempting to seize a police officer's weapon and was shot in the leg.

title: 'Sledging fired up Virat Kohli, but it rattled Shubman Gill'
content: Sanjay Manjrekar supports Shubman Gill to rebound in the fourth Test against England despite India trailing 1-2. Manjrekar acknowledged Gill's leadership while noting his aggression differs from Virat Kohli's. He observed Gill's frustration during the Lord's Test and how sledging might have affected his batting.

title: 2006 Mumbai train blasts: Torture of accused barbaric, inhuman, says HC
content: The Bombay High Court acquitted all accused in the train blasts case, deeming confessions extracted by the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) as inadmissible due to "barbaric and inhuman" torture. Accusations included severe physical abuse and psychological coercion, leading the court to question the validity of the confessions. The court also highlighted procedural lapses in invoking MCOCA, further undermining the prosecution's case.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Kamboj has control, and bowling brain like Zaheer, Bumrah' - Ashwin
content: Haryana seamer Anshul Kamboj has been drafted into India's Test team as cover for injured Arshdeep Singh and Akash Deep. R Ashwin believes Kamboj's first-class form and ability to bowl long spells make him a valuable asset in England. Ashwin also praises Kamboj's understanding and execution of plans, comparing him to Zaheer Khan and Jasprit Bumrah.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for July 22 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying DLF and Bajaj FinServ. DLF, exhibiting a flag pattern, is expected to break out upwards, targeting 880 with a stop loss at 838. Bajaj FinServ, having broken out of a triangle pattern, aims for 2135, supported by positive momentum and a stop loss at 2017.

title: ‚ÄòExtreme lack of effort‚Äô: Hillary Clinton email row back in spotlight
content: Senator Chuck Grassley released declassified documents revealing the FBI's allegedly inadequate investigation into Hillary Clinton's email server. Grassley claims the FBI, under Comey, showed a lack of due diligence and contrasted this with the Trump-Russia probe. The documents suggest potential interference by the Obama administration and raise questions about the handling of classified information.

title: 'Why would I': Hunter Biden denies bringing cocaine to White House
content: Hunter Biden denied any involvement with the cocaine found at the White House in 2023, during an interview Monday He stated he has been sober since 2019. The FBI recently reopened the case and President Donald Trump too insinuated without any evidence that the cocaine pouch was either from Joe Biden and Hunter.

title: Why cardiac arrests are striking young adults?
content: Cardiac arrests are increasing among young adults. Previously rare, these events now affect seemingly healthy individuals. Underlying heart conditions, lifestyle choices, and even COVID-19 may contribute. Early detection and prevention are crucial. Awareness of symptoms like chest pain and shortness of breath is important. Regular check-ups, healthy habits, and stress management can reduce risk.

title: Blackhawks may settle legal dispute tied to Connor Bedard‚Äôs top-line teammate
content: As the Chicago Blackhawks gear up for the 2025-26 season, optimism is tempered by a contract dispute with Arvid Soderblom. While focusing on developing their young core, led by Connor Bedard, the Blackhawks face uncertainty in their goaltending situation. The team is proactively building depth with signings like Stanislav Berezhnoy, ensuring they are prepared for all eventualities.

title: 2 sixes and OUT! Vaibhav Suryavanshi fails to fire again
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the aggressive left-handed opener, grabbed attention again in the second Youth Test against England U-19 with a quickfire 20 off 14 balls. This followed his impressive performance in the first match, where he scored a half-century and took two wickets. England U-19 posted 309, led by Ekansh Singh's century. Suryavanshi aims to contribute significantly in the second innings.

title: Air India got 9 showcauses in 6 months for safety violations: Minister
content: Air India received nine show-cause notices for safety violations, with one enforcement action completed, according to Union minister Murlidhar Mohol. While a Dreamliner crash occurred, no adverse reliability trends were reported. The government acknowledged staff shortages in key aviation agencies like DGCA, BCAS, and AAI, but stated that operations haven't been impacted, and recruitment efforts are ongoing to address the shortfall.

title: Stunning stat! India batters trail behind one man - England's Dawson
content: England has replaced injured Shoaib Bashir with Liam Dawson for the fourth Test against India at Old Trafford. Bashir suffered a finger fracture during the third Test, paving the way for Dawson's return after last playing a Test in 2017. England leads the series 2-1, with Dawson bringing valuable experience with both bat and ball to the team.

title: Udaipur Files: I&B panel OKs the movie; no Supreme Court nod yet
content: The I&B ministry's committee has cleared 'Udaipur Files: Kanhaiya Lal Tailor Murder' for release with modifications, including a new disclaimer and name changes, after ordering additional cuts beyond the CBFC's initial 55. However, the Supreme Court has temporarily halted the film's theatrical release, pending a hearing on Thursday to address petitioners' objections to the committee's order.

title: India, Pak continue shadow boxing with Notams along borders for air exercises
content: Following recent cross-border hostilities, India and Pakistan continue strategic posturing by issuing Notams to reserve airspace for exercises. The IAF plans air combat drills near the border from July 23-25, while Pakistan has issued Notams for its central and southern regions, reflecting ongoing tensions after the May conflict triggered by India's strikes on terror hubs.

title: Bihar 1st in country to get a cap of 1,200 voters per booth
content: Bihar is leading the way in electoral reform. The state has reduced the number of voters per polling station to 1,200. This change has increased the number of polling stations by 12,817. The Election Commission will implement this cap across India. The move aims to reduce long queues on polling day.

title: 'Total disaster': Trump slams Obama appointed judge in Harvard case hearing
content: Donald Trump has attacked a federal judge overseeing a legal dispute between his administration and Harvard University, alleging bias and promising to appeal any unfavorable ruling. He accused the judge, an Obama appointee, of being a "disaster" and claimed Harvard is anti-Semitic and anti-American despite its vast wealth.

title: PM: Celebrate ‚ÄòSindoor‚Äô success; oppn demands prompt discussion
content: PM Modi declared India's retaliation against terrorist camps inside Pakistan a complete success, amidst opposition demands for discussions on "Operation Sindoor" and the Pahalgam attack. The government agreed to a 16-hour debate next week. Congress criticized the delay in scheduling the Pahalgam discussion and demanded PM's response to Trump's claim regarding Operation Sindoor.

title: Paulina Gretzky‚Äôs Hollywood dreams, huge net worth show her own star
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of NHL legend Wayne Gretzky, has carved her own path with a $5 million net worth. Initially aiming for ballet, she transitioned to modeling and acting, appearing in movies like 'Fame' and 'Grown Ups 2'. She also explored singing, releasing her song 'Collecting Dust', and is now a social media influencer.

title: Dwyane Wade shows peaceful retreat after Kaavia‚Äôs ‚Äòcountry girl‚Äô moment
content: Dwyane Wade shares glimpses of his family moments. He posts videos of daughter Kaavia with a pony. Gabrielle Union is also seen in the video. Wade also shares a serene sea view from his vacation home. He emphasizes the importance of freedom for Kaavia. Wade and Union foster compassion and individuality in their parenting.

title: Travis Kelce goes solo in LA as Taylor Swift faces family emergency
content: Pop singer Taylor Swift is helping her father, Scott Swift, recover after heart surgery. Her partner, Travis Kelce, was seen driving in Los Angeles. Kelce is supporting Swift and her family during this time. He is also preparing for Kansas City Chiefs training camp. Kelce and his brother are pausing their podcast.

title: F-35B Fighter Leaves Kerala Airport After Being Stranded For 5 Weeks
content: The British Royal Navy's F-35B fighter jet, which had been stranded in Kerala for five weeks after making an emergency landing, has finally left the Thiruvananthapuram airport.

title: Inside Story: What Led To Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar's Shock Exit
content: An Opposition-sponsored motion to remove a judge after a massive cash recovery from his home set in motion the chain of events eventually leading to Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar's shock resignation last night.

title: Appellate Tribunal Upholds Seizure Of Chanda Kochhar's Assets In Videocon Loan Case
content: An appellate tribunal has found Chanda Kochhar, former CEO and managing director of ICICI Bank, guilty of accepting Rs 64 crore bribes that were routed through her husband Deepak Kochhar from the Videocon Group.

title: Heavy Rain Triggers Flood-Like Situation In Parts Of J&K, Schools Closed
content: Heavy rain in parts of Jammu and Kashmir have caused a flood-like situation in several places, officials said today. As a precautionary measure, the administration has ordered the closure of schools today.

title: Explained: How A Vice President Is Elected In India
content: The election is conducted under the supervision of the Election Commission, which appoints a Returning Officer, typically a senior parliamentary official, to oversee the process.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Live: "Nothing To Say," Says M Kharge On Jagdeep Dhankhar's Resignation
content: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 2 Live Updates: Rajya Sabha Chairman and Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post, citing "medical advice".

title: Minor Sexually Assaulted By Truck Driver In Odisha, Accused Arrested: Cops
content: In yet another disturbing incident from Odisha, a minor girl was sexually assaulted by a truck driver in the Malkangiri district, according to police reports on Tuesday.

title: "F**k Him, He's Not Actor": Why Joe Biden's Son Is Angry With George Clooney
content: Former US President Joe Biden's son, Hunter Biden, slammed actor and mega Democrat donor George Clooney, for his 2024 op-ed in The New York Times calling on the Democratic Party to change their Presidential nominee for the 2024 US elections.

title: "I Was Very Scared": Minor Victim Of Deliberate Dog Bite Case In Mumbai
content: The minor boy, victim of the dog bite incident that happened on July 17 in Mumbai, said that the accused, Sohail Khan, released the dog towards him when he was sitting with his friends. His Friends escaped but he couldn't.

title: A Murder To Avenge Mother's Insult After 10 Years. Not A Bollywood Script
content: Sonu Kashyap, who, driven by his thirst for revenge, roamed the streets of Lucknow for the next 10 years in search of the man who had insulted his mother.

title: Delhi Air Quality Moderate, Weather Office Predicts Rain With Thunderstorms
content: The city recorded a minimum temperature of 26 degrees Celsius on Tuesday, with the weather office predicting rain along with thunderstorm.

title: Two Bihar Hospital Shooting Accused Injured In Encounter, Shot On Hands, Legs
content: During interrogation, the two men admitted to their involved in the murder of gangster Chandan Mishra in Bihar.

title: SBI Classifies Reliance Communications, Promoter Anil Ambani As "Fraud"
content: State Bank of India has classified Reliance Communications along with promoter director Anil D Ambani as 'fraud' and is also in the process of lodging complaint with CBI, Parliament was informed on Monday.

title: "Unusual, Surreal": What Astronomer's New CEO Said After Coldplay Video Saga
content: Pete DeJoy became the interim CEO of Astronomer after Andy Byron resigned following an embarrassing episode at a Coldplay concert.

title: 10 Days Back, Veep Said Will "Retire At Right Time", Added "Divine" Rider
content: Ten days before his surprise resignation, Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar had said he would "retire at the right time, August 2027", indicating that he would complete his current term.

title: Bangladesh School Jet Crash Death Count Rises To 27, Dozens Still Critical
content: A Bangladesh Air Force training aircraft crashed into a school in Dhaka, the country's capital, shortly after takeoff on Monday afternoon, killing the pilot and 26 other people, most of whom were students, officials said.

title: How A Smart Watch Helped Locate Montana Plane Crash Wreckage
content: Search teams located the site of an airplane crash that killed three people near Yellowstone National Park using the last known location of the smart watch from one of the victims, authorities said Monday.

title: Subway Names Jonathan Fitzpatrick, Former Burger King Executive, As CEO
content: Jonathan Fitzpatrick is the first CEO hired since Subway was bought by the private equity firm Roark Capital in 2024. And Roark didn't have to look far to find him.

title: "Colleague Collapsed Pleading To Be Saved": Dhaka Teacher On Crash Horror
content: The Milestone School in Dhaka's Uttara neighbourhood was the site of a deadly fighter jet crash that left 19 dead on Monday morning.

title: Trump Told Netanyahu To "Rectify" Situation After Syria Attack: White House
content: US President Donald Trump was not kept in the loop about Israeli strikes on Syria and had to call Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin "Bibi" Netanyahu to rectify the situation, the White House said on Monday.

title: From Aaron Rodgers to the tush push, let's catch up on an active offseason
content: it's technically the offseason, but there has been plenty of action around the league in the five months since confetti rained down on the Philadelphia Eagles in new Orleans . there's going to be a lot of mail rerouted to and from Pittsburgh after this offseason . general manager Omar Khan spent the last couple of months wheeling and dealing .

title: Fights we want to see: Usyk-Parker, Teofimo-Rolly and Joshua-Paul?
content: Oleksandr Usyk knocks out Daniel Dubois in round 5 to become undisputed world heavyweight champion again . we turn to the remaining boxing calendar in 2025 . canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford will meet in the biggest fight of the year on sept. 13 .

title: How to quit your smartphone addiction, guided by science
content: study: people are becoming increasingly addicted to smartphones . in every country tested, and in all ages, nearly 57% of those asked admitted to being addicted to their phones . people are getting tired of their smartphone behaviours, a social scientist says . if you are addicted, you can test whether you are on the Smartphone Addiction Scale .
